name: Post-Industrial
description: Umbrella group of genres that combine the dark, mechanical aesthetic of early Industrial music with more accessible genres, such as Rock and Electronic Dance Music.

children.name: Dark Ambient
children.description: Emphasizes an ominous, gloomy, and dissonant atmosphere.

children.name: Deconstructed Club
children.description: Emerged in the 2010s as the hybridization of diverse Electronic Dance Music genres with an abrasive Post-Industrial sound.

children.name: EBM
children.description: Melodic and dancefloor-friendly take on Post-Industrial music that developed in the early 1980s.

children.name: Electro-Industrial
children.description: Formed in the late 1980s and early 1990s; grew out of a combination of EBM and Industrial.

children.name: Industrial Hardcore
children.description: Fuses the sonic palettes and aesthetics of Industrial with the intense rhythms of Gabber, Speedcore, Doomcore and other subsequent styles.

children.name: Industrial Hip Hop
children.description: Incorporates harsh elements inspired by Industrial music such as blaring, noisy synths, distorted and metallic percussion, as well as more aggressive and off-kilter rapping styles.

children.name: Industrial Metal
children.description: Incorporates the abrasive and heavy sound of Industrial into Metal, using elements like synthesizers and drum machines.

children.name: Industrial Rock
children.description: Incorporates abrasive guitars and synthesizers inspired by Industrial and various Post-Industrial styles.

children.name: Industrial Techno
children.description: Harder, darker style of Techno which draws parallels with factories and the rhythm of machinery.

children.name: Martial Industrial
children.description: Incorporates elements of traditional European military marches with Neoclassical Darkwave, Dark Ambient, Industrial, and Neofolk.

children.name: Power Noise
children.description: Combines looped samples of Noise with Electronic rhythms.
